channel.title: InternetNews Realtime News for IT Managers
channel.description: All the top news, features, analysis and insight into enterprise and Internet technology, geared for IT managers and delivered by the best in the industry.

item.title: Microsoft Pins Mobile Data Snag on Yahoo Mail
item.description: After weeks of blaming large volumes of unnecessary data traffic on its mobile network to an unidentified third-party app, Microsoft is now confirming that the culprit is Yahoo Mail.

item.title: Wireless Data Traffic Soaring: Cisco
item.description: Latest research from networking giant reveals 150 percent surge in mobile data traffic in 2010, a trend that's projected to continue over the next several years.

item.title: AT&T Unveils Mobile PBX for iPhone, BlackBerry
item.description: The free, cloud-based app lets small businesses and departments add new calling features to wired and mobile devices from a smartphone.

item.title: IBM Debuts Cognos BI Tool for Midsize Firms
item.description: Big Blue updates Cognos business intelligence line with new tool, dubbed Cognos Express Planner, aiming to deliver sophisticated forecasting services.

item.title: IPv4 Death March Picks Up Steam
item.description: Bring on IPv6. Or perhaps a more realistic slogan would be "hurry up and wait."

item.title: Google Docs Update Enhances Access to Content
item.description: The search giant makes it easier to organize, retrieve and share content from its cloud-based Google Docs system.

item.title: White House Rolls Out 'Startup America' Drive
item.description: Linking the cultivation of innovate new small businesses with job growth, Obama administration to marshal government resources to catalyze private-sector investment.

item.title: Workshare Debuts Office-SharePoint Tie-in
item.description: Firm specializing in file-comparison and document-collaboration tools ships new product intended to build a better pipeline between Microsoft's SharePoint and Office productivity suite.

item.title: Microsoft Courts Intel, AMD for 16-Core Servers
item.description: As it looks to cut energy consumption and boost power at its expanding global data centers, Microsoft is in talks with leading chip markers for 16-core server processors.

item.title: Android Takes Smartphone Top Spot
item.description: Latest Canalys report shows Android has the most shipments worldwide of any other smartphone platform. Guess who came in second?

item.title: Monster Debuts First iPad Recruitment App
item.description: The mega-job site is building on the success of its iPhone app to give iPad owners a new way to search for jobs.

item.title: Microsoft Issues New Zero-Day Security Advisory
item.description: The software giant said the vulnerability is common to all versions of Windows.

item.title: VeriSign Planning DNSSEC, IPv6 Push in 2011
item.description: Domain infrastructure leader reports solid earnings for the fourth quarter and full year as it looks ahead to the challenges and opportunities that will come with the next phase of the Internet's development.

item.title: Is Patent Reform Coming? Week in Preview Podcast, Jan. 31, 2011
item.description: Patent reform in our lifetime? A new opening for OpenStack and what tech company is celebrating its 100 year anniversary. Hint: It's not Facebook.

item.title: Data Privacy Survey Has Some Surprising Results
item.description: A survey timed to be released on Data Privacy Day indicates that Americans are more concerned about online privacy violations than losing their jobs.

item.title: Verizon Pays $1.4B for Cloud Player Terremark
item.description: Looking to build out its cloud services business, telecom giant Verizon shells out $1.4 billion to acquire Terremark, converting to the publicly traded company into a wholly owned subsidiary.

item.title: Egypt Unplugs Internet, Wireless Networks
item.description: Facing widespread anti-government protests, Egyptian authorities take the unprecedented step of directing ISPs and wireless carriers to shut off service.

item.title: Intel Ramps Up Fiber Channel Over Ethernet Push
item.description: The chip giant says its Open FCoE technology is now being supported by a number of major vendors.

item.title: Hospital Taps Cisco for More Virtualization
item.description: The Moses Cone Health System says its reaping the benefits of a move to virtualization back in 2007.

item.title: In Search of Macworld Expo Buzz
item.description: Venerable Mac trade show has branched out to include products and software for the new crop of Apple devices, but the show's glory days seem to be behind it.
